text: "Ok

author: Brianna Kennedy-Beal
text: "First
column5: I wanted to create my own pitaya bowl
column6: but they told me that they were out of pitaya until Monday. They said they only have frozen pitaya
column7: which is used for the smoothies and is like a popsicle.\nOnce I settled for an acai bowl
column8: I was asked what fruit I want
column9: but was not given any options. I usually get strawberry
column13: but they didn't have kiwi either. Again
column14: I settled for something else and took my bowl to-go.\nBy the time I got home about 20 minutes later
column15: my bowl was completely watery. The acai mixture that was used must have been water based and frozen as well
column16: because the texture lacks any substance at all. The mango was really slimy and not fresh and the banana tastes off as well.\nAll that is really required to make a acai bowl is to put fresh fruit into a blender
column17: a hard thing to mess up. From my experience
column18: the only fresh ingredients seem to be some of the fruit toppings. These bowls are expensive for what they are; customers should expect fresh fruit for this price. I will not be returning"
